Raag Maajh − Part 001 94 : 1 Raag Maajh, Chau−Padas, First House, Fourth Mehl: 94 : 2 One Universal Creator God. The Name Is Truth. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying, Beyond Birth, Self−Existent. By Guru's Grace: 94 : 3 The Name of the Lord, Har, Har, is pleasing to my mind. 94 : 4 By great good fortune, I meditate on the Lord's Name. 94 : 5 The Perfect Guru has attained spiritual perfection in the Name of the Lord. How rare are those who follow the Guru's Teachings. ||1|| 94 : 6 I have loaded my pack with the provisions of the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. 94 : 7 The Companion of my breath of life shall always be with me. 94 : 8 The Perfect Guru has implanted the Lord's Name within me. I have the Imperishable Treasure of the Lord in my lap. ||2|| 94 : 9 2

The Lord, Har, Har, is my Best Friend; He is my Beloved Lord King. 94 : 10 If only someone would come and introduce me to Him, the Rejuvenator of my breath of life. 94 : 11 I cannot survive without seeing my Beloved. My eyes are welling up with tears. ||3|| 94 : 12 My Friend, the True Guru, has been my Best Friend since I was very young. 94 : 13 I cannot survive without seeing Him, O my mother! 94 : 14 O Dear Lord, please show Mercy to me, that I may meet the Guru. Servant Nanak gathers the Wealth of the Lord's Name in his lap. ||4||1|| 94 : 15 Maajh, Fourth Mehl: 94 : 16 The Lord is my mind, body and breath of life. 94 : 17 I do not know any other than the Lord. 94 : 18 If only I could have the good fortune to meet some friendly Saint; he might show me the Way to my Beloved Lord God. ||1|| Raag Maajh − Part 001 3

94 : 19 I have searched my mind and body, through and through. 94 : 20 How can I meet my Darling Beloved, O my mother? 94 : 21 Joining the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation, I ask about the Path to God. In that Congregation, the Lord God abides. ||2|| 94 : 22 My Darling Beloved True Guru is my Protector. 94 : 23 I am a helpless child−please cherish me. 94 : 24 The Guru, the Perfect True Guru, is my Mother and Father. Obtaining the Water of the Guru, the lotus of my heart blossoms forth. ||3|| 94 : 25 Without seeing my Guru, sleep does not come. 94 : 26 My mind and body are afflicted with the pain of separation from the Guru. 94 : 27 O Lord, Har, Har, show mercy to me, that I may meet my Guru. Meeting the Guru, servant Nanak blossoms forth. ||4||2|| −− Raag Maajh − Part 001 −− Raag Maajh − Part 001 4
Raag Maajh − Part 001 5

Raag Maajh − Part 002 95 : 28 Maajh, Fourth Mehl: 95 : 29 Read of the Lord's Glories and reflect upon the Lord's Glories. 95 : 30 Listen continually to the Sermon of the Naam, the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. 95 : 31 Joining the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation, and singing the Glorious Praises of the Lord, you shall cross over the treacherous and terrifying world−ocean. ||1|| 95 : 32 Come, friends, let us meet our Lord. 95 : 33 Bring me a message from my Beloved. 95 : 34 He alone is a friend, companion, beloved and brother of mine, who shows me the way to the Lord, the Lord of all. ||2|| 95 : 35 My illness is known only to the Lord and the Perfect Guru. 95 : 36 I cannot continue living without chanting the Naam. 6

95 : 37 So give me the medicine, the Mantra of the Perfect Guru. Through the Name of the Lord, Har, Har, I am saved. ||3|| 95 : 38 I am just a poor song−bird, in the Sanctuary of the True Guru, 95 : 39 who has placed the Drop of Water, the Lord's Name, Har, Har, in my mouth. 95 : 40 The Lord is the Treasure of Water; I am just a fish in that water. Without this Water, servant Nanak would die. ||4||3|| 95 : 41 Maajh, Fourth Mehl: 95 : 42 O servants of the Lord, O Saints, O my Siblings of Destiny, let us join together! 95 : 43 Show me the way to my Lord God−I am so hungry for Him! 95 : 44 Please reward my faith, O Life of the World, O Great Giver. Obtaining the Blessed Vision of the Lord's Darshan, my mind is fulfilled. ||1|| 95 : 45 Joining the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation, I chant the Bani of the Lord's Word. 95 : 46 Raag Maajh − Part 002 7

The Sermon of the Lord, Har, Har, is pleasing to my mind. 95 : 47 The Ambrosial Nectar of the Lord's Name, Har, Har, is so sweet to my mind. Meeting the True Guru, I drink in this Ambrosial Nectar. ||2|| 95 : 48 By great good fortune, the Lord's Congregation is found, 95 : 49 while the unfortunate ones wander around in doubt, enduring painful beatings. 95 : 50 Without good fortune, the Sat Sangat is not found; without this Sangat, people are stained with filth and pollution. ||3|| 95 : 51 Come and meet me, O Life of the World, my Beloved. 95 : 52 Please bless me with Your Mercy, and enshrine Your Name, Har, Har, within my mind. 95 : 53 Through the Guru's Teachings, the Sweet Name has become pleasing to my mind. Servant Nanak's mind is drenched and delighted with the Naam. ||4||4|| 95 : 54 Maajh, Fourth Mehl: 95 : 55 Raag Maajh − Part 002 8

Through the Guru, I have obtained the Lord's spiritual wisdom. I have obtained the Sublime Essence of the Lord. 95 : 56 My mind is imbued with the Love of the Lord; I drink in the Sublime Essence of the Lord. 95 : 57 With my mouth, I chant the Name of the Lord, Har, Har; my mind is filled to overflowing with the Sublime Essence of the Lord. ||1|| 95 : 58 Come, O Saints, and lead me to my Lord's Embrace. 95 : 59 Recite to me the Sermon of my Beloved. 95 : 60 I dedicate my mind to those Saints of the Lord, who chant the Word of the Guru's Bani with their mouths. ||2|| 95 : 61 By great good fortune, the Lord has led me to meet His Saint. 95 : 62 The Perfect Guru has placed the Sublime Essence of the Lord into my mouth. 95 : 63 The unfortunate ones do not find the True Guru; the self−willed manmukhs continually endure reincarnation through the womb. ||3|| 95 : 64 Raag Maajh − Part 002 9

God, the Merciful, has Himself bestowed His Mercy. 95 : 65 He has totally removed the poisonous pollution of egotism. 95 : 66 O Nanak, in the shops of the city of the human body, the Gurmukhs buy the merchandise of the Lord's Name. ||4||5|| 95 : 67 Maajh, Fourth Mehl: 95 : 68 I meditate on the Glorious Praises of the Lord of the Universe, and the Name of the Lord. 95 : 69 Joining the Sangat, the Holy Congregation, the Name comes to dwell in the mind. 95 : 70 The Lord God is our Lord and Master, Inaccessible and Unfathomable. Meeting the True Guru, I enjoy the Sublime Essence of the Lord. ||1|| −− Raag Maajh − Part 002 −− Raag Maajh − Part 002 10

Raag Maajh − Part 003 96 : 71 Blessed, blessed are the humble servants of the Lord, who know the Lord God. 96 : 72 I go and ask those humble servants about the Mysteries of the Lord. 96 : 73 I wash and massage their feet; joining with the humble servants of the Lord, I drink in the Sublime Essence of the Lord. ||2|| 96 : 74 The True Guru, the Giver, has implanted the Naam, the Name of the Lord, within me. 96 : 75 By great good fortune, I have obtained the Blessed Vision of the Guru's Darshan. 96 : 76 The True Essence is Ambrosial Nectar; through the Ambrosial Words of the Perfect Guru, this Amrit is obtained. ||3|| 96 : 77 O Lord, lead me to the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation, and the true beings. 96 : 78 Joining the Sat Sangat, I meditate on the Lord's Name. 96 : 79 O Nanak, I listen and chant the Lord's Sermon; through the Guru's Teachings, I am fulfilled 11

by the Name of the Lord. ||4||6|| 96 : 80 Maajh, Fourth Mehl: 96 : 81 Come, dear sisters−let us join together. 96 : 82 I am a sacrifice to the one who tells me of my Beloved. 96 : 83 Joining the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation, I have found the Lord, my Best Friend. I am a sacrifice to the True Guru. ||1|| 96 : 84 Wherever I look, there I see my Lord and Master. 96 : 85 You are permeating each and every heart, O Lord, Inner−knower, Searcher of Hearts. 96 : 86 The Perfect Guru has shown me that the Lord is always with me. I am forever a sacrifice to the True Guru. ||2|| 96 : 87 There is only one breath; all are made of the same clay; the light within all is the same. 96 : 88 The One Light pervades all the many and various beings. This Light intermingles with them, but it is not diluted or obscured. Raag Maajh − Part 003 12

96 : 89 By Guru's Grace, I have come to see the One. I am a sacrifice to the True Guru. ||3|| 96 : 90 Servant Nanak speaks the Ambrosial Bani of the Word. 96 : 91 It is dear and pleasing to the minds of the GurSikhs. 96 : 92 The Guru, the Perfect True Guru, shares the Teachings. The Guru, the True Guru, is Generous to all. ||4||7|| 96 : 93 Seven Chau−Padas Of The Fourth Mehl. || 96 : 94 Maajh, Fifth Mehl, Chau−Padas, First House: 96 : 95 My mind longs for the Blessed Vision of the Guru's Darshan. 96 : 96 It cries out like the thirsty song−bird. 96 : 97 My thirst is not quenched, and I can find no peace, without the Blessed Vision of the Beloved Saint. ||1|| 96 : 98 Raag Maajh − Part 003 13

I am a sacrifice, my soul is a sacrifice, to the Blessed Vision of the Beloved Saint Guru. ||1||Pause|| 96 : 99 Your Face is so Beautiful, and the Sound of Your Words imparts intuitive wisdom. 96 : 100 It is so long since this rainbird has had even a glimpse of water. 96 : 101 Blessed is that land where You dwell, O my Friend and Intimate Divine Guru. ||2|| 96 : 102 I am a sacrifice, I am forever a sacrifice, to my Friend and Intimate Divine Guru. ||1||Pause|| 96 : 103 When I could not be with You for just one moment, the Dark Age of Kali Yuga dawned for me. 96 : 104 When will I meet You, O my Beloved Lord? −− Raag Maajh − Part 003 −− Raag Maajh − Part 003 14

Raag Maajh − Part 004 97 : 105 I cannot endure the night, and sleep does not come, without the Sight of the Beloved Guru's Court. ||3|| 97 : 106 I am a sacrifice, my soul is a sacrifice, to that True Court of the Beloved Guru. ||1||Pause|| 97 : 107 By good fortune, I have met the Saint Guru. 97 : 108 I have found the Immortal Lord within the home of my own self. 97 : 109 I will now serve You forever, and I shall never be separated from You, even for an instant. Servant Nanak is Your slave, O Beloved Master. ||4|| 97 : 110 I am a sacrifice, my soul is a sacrifice; servant Nanak is Your slave, Lord. ||Pause||1||8|| 97 : 111 Raag Maajh, Fifth Mehl: 97 : 112 Sweet is that season when I remember You. 97 : 113 Sublime is that work which is done for You. 15

97 : 114 Blessed is that heart in which You dwell, O Giver of all. ||1|| 97 : 115 You are the Universal Father of all, O my Lord and Master. 97 : 116 Your nine treasures are an inexhaustible storehouse. 97 : 117 Those unto whom You give are satisfied and fulfilled; they become Your devotees, Lord. ||2|| 97 : 118 All place their hopes in You. 97 : 119 You dwell deep within each and every heart. 97 : 120 All share in Your Grace; none are beyond You. ||3|| 97 : 121 You Yourself liberate the Gurmukhs; 97 : 122 You Yourself consign the self−willed manmukhs to wander in reincarnation. 97 : 123 Slave Nanak is a sacrifice to You; Your Entire Play is self−evident, Lord. ||4||2||9|| Raag Maajh − Part 004 16

97 : 124 Maajh, Fifth Mehl: 97 : 125 The Unstruck Melody resounds and resonates in peaceful ease. 97 : 126 I rejoice in the eternal bliss of the Word of the Shabad. 97 : 127 In the cave of intuitive wisdom I sit, absorbed in the silent trance of the Primal Void. I have obtained my seat in the heavens. ||1|| 97 : 128 After wandering through many other homes and houses, I have returned to my own home, 97 : 129 and I have found what I was longing for. 97 : 130 I am satisfied and fulfilled; O Saints, the Guru has shown me the Fearless Lord God. ||2|| 97 : 131 He Himself is the King, and He Himself is the people. 97 : 132 He Himself is in Nirvaanaa, and He Himself indulges in pleasures. 97 : 133 He Himself sits on the throne of true justice, answering the cries and prayers of all. ||3|| Raag Maajh − Part 004 17

97 : 134 As I have seen Him, so have I described Him. 97 : 135 This Sublime Essence comes only to one who knows the Mystery of the Lord. 97 : 136 His light merges into the Light, and he finds peace. O servant Nanak, this is all the Extension of the One. ||4||3||10|| 97 : 137 Maajh, Fifth Mehl: 97 : 138 That house, in which the soul−bride has married her Husband Lord 97 : 139 −in that house, O my companions, sing the songs of rejoicing. 97 : 140 Joy and celebrations decorate that house, in which the Husband Lord has adorned His soul−bride. ||1|| 97 : 141 She is virtuous, and she is very fortunate; 97 : 142 she is blessed with sons and tender−hearted. The happy soul−bride is loved by her Husband. 97 : 143 Raag Maajh − Part 004 18

She is beautiful, wise, and clever. That soul−bride is the beloved of her Husband Lord. ||2|| 97 : 144 She is well−mannered, noble and distinguished. 97 : 145 She is decorated and adorned with wisdom. 97 : 146 She is from a most respected family; she is the queen, adorned with the Love of her Husband Lord. ||3|| 97 : 147 Her glory cannot be described; 97 : 148 she melts in the Embrace of her Husband Lord. −− Raag Maajh − Part 004 −− Raag Maajh − Part 004 19

Raag Maajh − Part 005 98 : 149 Her marriage is eternal; her Husband is Inaccessible and Incomprehensible. O Servant Nanak, His Love is her only Support. ||4||4||11|| 98 : 150 Maajh, Fifth Mehl: 98 : 151 I have searched and searched, seeking the Blessed Vision of His Darshan. 98 : 152 I travelled through all sorts of woods and forests. 98 : 153 My Lord, Har, Har, is both absolute and related, unmanifest and manifest; is there anyone who can come and unite me with Him? ||1|| 98 : 154 People recite from memory the wisdom of the six schools of philosophy; 98 : 155 they perform worship services, wear ceremonial religious marks on their foreheads, and take ritual cleansing baths at sacred shrines of pilgrimage. 98 : 156 They perform the inner cleansing practice with water and adopt the eighty−four Yogic postures; but still, they find no peace in any of these. ||2|| 98 : 157 20

They chant and meditate, practicing austere self−discipline for years and years; 98 : 158 they wander on journeys all over the earth; 98 : 159 and yet, their hearts are not at peace, even for an instant. The Yogi rises up and goes out, over and over again. ||3|| 98 : 160 By His Mercy, I have met the Holy Saint. 98 : 161 My mind and body have been cooled and soothed; I have been blessed with patience and composure. 98 : 162 The Immortal Lord God has come to dwell within my heart. Nanak sings the songs of joy to the Lord. ||4||5||12|| 98 : 163 Maajh, Fifth Mehl: 98 : 164 The Supreme Lord God is Infinite and Divine; 98 : 165 He is Inaccessible, Incomprehensible, Invisible and Inscrutable. 98 : 166 Raag Maajh − Part 005 21

Merciful to the meek, Sustainer of the World, Lord of the Universe−meditating on the Lord, the Gurmukhs find salvation. ||1|| 98 : 167 The Gurmukhs are emancipated by the Lord. 98 : 168 The Lord Krishna becomes the Gurmukh's Companion. 98 : 169 The Gurmukh finds the Merciful Lord. He is not found any other way. ||2|| 98 : 170 He does not need to eat; His Hair is Wondrous and Beautiful; He is free of hate. 98 : 171 Millions of people worship His Feet. 98 : 172 He alone is a devotee, who becomes Gurmukh, whose heart is filled with the Lord, Har, Har. ||3|| 98 : 173 Forever fruitful is the Blessed Vision of His Darshan; He is Infinite and Incomparable. 98 : 174 He is Awesome and All−powerful; He is forever the Great Giver. 98 : 175 As Gurmukh, chant the Naam, the Name of the Lord, and you shall be carried across. O Nanak, rare are those who know this state! ||4||6||13|| Raag Maajh − Part 005 22

98 : 176 Maajh, Fifth Mehl: 98 : 177 As You command, I obey; as You give, I receive. 98 : 178 You are the Pride of the meek and the poor. 98 : 179 You are everything; You are my Beloved. I am a sacrifice to Your Creative Power. ||1|| 98 : 180 By Your Will, we wander in the wilderness; by Your Will, we find the path. 98 : 181 By Your Will, we become Gurmukh and sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord. 98 : 182 By Your Will, we wander in doubt through countless lifetimes. Everything happens by Your Will. ||2|| 98 : 183 No one is foolish, and no one is clever. 98 : 184 Your Will determines everything; 98 : 185 You are Inaccessible, Incomprehensible, Infinite and Unfathomable. Your Value cannot be Raag Maajh − Part 005 23

expressed. ||3|| 98 : 186 Please bless me with the dust of the Saints, O my Beloved. 98 : 187 I have come and fallen at Your Door, O Lord. 98 : 188 Gazing upon the Blessed Vision of His Darshan, my mind is fulfilled. O Nanak, with natural ease, I merge into Him. ||4||7||14|| 98 : 189 Maajh, Fifth Mehl: 98 : 190 They forget the Lord, and they suffer in pain. 98 : 191 Afflicted with hunger, they run around in all directions. 98 : 192 Meditating in remembrance on the Naam, they are happy forever. The Lord, Merciful to the meek, bestows it upon them. ||1|| 98 : 193 My True Guru is absolutely All−powerful. −− Raag Maajh − Part 005 −− Raag Maajh − Part 005 24

Raag Maajh − Part 006 99 : 194 When I dwell upon Him in my soul, all my sorrows depart. 99 : 195 The sickness of anxiety and the disease of ego are cured; He Himself cherishes me. ||2|| 99 : 196 Like a child, I ask for everything. 99 : 197 God is Bountiful and Beautiful; He never comes up empty. 99 : 198 Again and again, I fall at His Feet. He is Merciful to the meek, the Sustainer of the World. ||3|| 99 : 199 I am a sacrifice to the Perfect True Guru, 99 : 200 who has shattered all my bonds. 99 : 201 With the Naam, the Name of the Lord, in my heart, I have been purified. O Nanak, His Love has imbued me with nectar. ||4||8||15|| 99 : 202 Maajh, Fifth Mehl: 25

99 : 203 O my Love, Sustainer of the World, Merciful, Loving Lord, 99 : 204 Profoundly Deep, Infinite Lord of the Universe, 99 : 205 Highest of the High, Unfathomable, Infinite Lord and Master: continually remembering You in deep meditation, I live. ||1|| 99 : 206 O Destroyer of pain, Priceless Treasure, 99 : 207 Fearless, free of hate, Unfathomable, Immeasurable, 99 : 208 of Undying Form, Unborn, Self−illumined: remembering You in meditation, my mind is filled with a deep and profound peace. ||2|| 99 : 209 The Joyous Lord, the Sustainer of the World, is my constant Companion. 99 : 210 He cherishes the high and the low. 99 : 211 The Nectar of the Name satisfies my mind. As Gurmukh, I drink in the Ambrosial Nectar. ||3|| 99 : 212 Raag Maajh − Part 006 26

In suffering and in comfort, I meditate on You, O Beloved. 99 : 213 I have obtained this sublime understanding from the Guru. 99 : 214 You are Nanak's Support, O my Lord and Master; through Your Love, I swim across to the other side. ||4||9||16|| 99 : 215 Maajh, Fifth Mehl: 99 : 216 Blessed is that time when I meet the True Guru. 99 : 217 Gazing upon the Fruitful Vision of His Darshan, I have been saved. 99 : 218 Blessed are the hours, the minutes and the seconds−blessed is that Union with Him. ||1|| 99 : 219 Making the effort, my mind has become pure. 99 : 220 Walking on the Lord's Path, my doubts have all been cast out. 99 : 221 The True Guru has inspired me to hear the Treasure of the Naam; all my illness has been dispelled. ||2|| Raag Maajh − Part 006 27

99 : 222 The Word of Your Bani is inside and outside as well. 99 : 223 You Yourself chant it, and You Yourself speak it. 99 : 224 The Guru has said that He is One−All is the One. There shall never be any other. ||3|| 99 : 225 I drink in the Lord's Ambrosial Essence from the Guru; 99 : 226 the Lord's Name has become my clothing and food. 99 : 227 The Name is my delight, the Name is my play and entertainment. O Nanak, I have made the Name my enjoyment. ||4||10||17|| 99 : 228 Maajh, Fifth Mehl: 99 : 229 I beg of all the Saints: please, give me the merchandise. 99 : 230 I offer my prayers−I have forsaken my pride. 99 : 231 I am a sacrifice, hundreds of thousands of times a sacrifice, and I pray: please, give me the Raag Maajh − Part 006 28

dust of the feet of the Saints. ||1|| 99 : 232 You are the Giver, You are the Architect of Destiny. 99 : 233 You are All−powerful, the Giver of Eternal Peace. 99 : 234 You bless everyone. Please bring my life to fulfillment. ||2|| 99 : 235 The body−temple is sanctified by the Blessed Vision of Your Darshan, 99 : 236 and thus, the impregnable fort of the soul is conquered. 99 : 237 You are the Giver, You are the Architect of Destiny. There is no other warrior as great as You. ||3|| −− Raag Maajh − Part 006 −− Raag Maajh − Part 006 29

Raag Maajh − Part 007 100 : 238 I applied the dust of the feet of the Saints to my face. 100 : 239 My evil−mindedness disappeared, along with my misfortune and false−mindedness. 100 : 240 I sit in the true home of my self; I sing His Glorious Praises. O Nanak, my falsehood has vanished! ||4||11||18|| 100 : 241 Maajh, Fifth Mehl: 100 : 242 I shall never forget You−You are such a Great Giver! 100 : 243 Please grant Your Grace, and imbue me with the love of devotional worship. 100 : 244 If it pleases You, let me meditate on You day and night; please, grant me this gift! ||1|| 100 : 245 Into this blind clay, You have infused awareness. 100 : 246 Everything, everywhere which You have given is good. 30

100 : 247 Bliss, joyful celebrations, wondrous plays and entertainment−whatever pleases You, comes to pass. ||2|| 100 : 248 Everything we receive is a gift from Him 100 : 249 −the thirty−six delicious foods to eat, 100 : 250 cozy beds, cooling breezes, peaceful joy and the experience of pleasure. ||3|| 100 : 251 Give me that state of mind, by which I may not forget You. 100 : 252 Give me that understanding, by which I may meditate on You. 100 : 253 I sing Your Glorious Praises with each and every breath. Nanak takes the Support of the Guru's Feet. ||4||12||19|| 100 : 254 Maajh, Fifth Mehl: 100 : 255 To praise You is to follow Your Command and Your Will. 100 : 256 Raag Maajh − Part 007 31

That which pleases You is spiritual wisdom and meditation. 100 : 257 That which pleases God is chanting and meditation; to be in harmony with His Will is perfect spiritual wisdom. ||1|| 100 : 258 He alone sings Your Ambrosial Naam, who is pleasing to Your Mind, O my Lord and Master. 100 : 259 You belong to the Saints, and the Saints belong to You. The minds of the Saints are attuned to You, O my Lord and Master. ||2|| 100 : 260 You cherish and nurture the Saints. 100 : 261 The Saints play with You, O Sustainer of the World. 100 : 262 Your Saints are very dear to You. You are the breath of life of the Saints. ||3|| 100 : 263 My mind is a sacrifice to those Saints who know You, 100 : 264 and are pleasing to Your Mind. 100 : 265 Raag Maajh − Part 007 32

In their company I have found a lasting peace. Nanak is satisfied and fulfilled with the Sublime Essence of the Lord. ||4||13||20|| 100 : 266 Maajh, Fifth Mehl 100 : 267 : You are the Ocean of Water, and I am Your fish. 100 : 268 Your Name is the drop of water, and I am a thirsty rainbird. 100 : 269 You are my hope, and You are my thirst. My mind is absorbed in You. ||1|| 100 : 270 Just as the baby is satisfied by drinking milk, 100 : 271 and the poor person is pleased by seeing wealth, 100 : 272 and the thirsty person is refreshed by drinking cool water, so is this mind drenched with delight in the Lord. ||2|| 100 : 273 Just as the darkness is lit up by the lamp, 100 : 274 and the hopes of the wife are fulfilled by thinking about her husband, Raag Maajh − Part 007 33

100 : 275 and people are filled with bliss upon meeting their beloved, so is my mind imbued with the Lord's Love. ||3|| 100 : 276 The Saints have set me upon the Lord's Path. 100 : 277 By the Grace of the Holy Saint, I have been attuned to the Lord. 100 : 278 The Lord is mine, and I am the slave of the Lord. O Nanak, the Guru has blessed me with the True Word of the Shabad. ||4||14||21|| 100 : 279 Maajh, Fifth Mehl: 100 : 280 The Ambrosial Naam, the Name of the Lord, is eternally pure. 100 : 281 The Lord is the Giver of Peace and the Dispeller of sorrow. 100 : 282 I have seen and tasted all other flavors, but to my mind, the Subtle Essence of the Lord is the sweetest of all. ||1|| −− Raag Maajh − Part 007 −− Raag Maajh − Part 007 34

Raag Maajh − Part 008 101 : 283 Whoever drinks this in, is satisfied. 101 : 284 Whoever obtains the Sublime Essence of the Naam becomes immortal. 101 : 285 The Treasure of the Naam is obtained by one whose mind is filled with the Word of the Guru's Shabad. ||2|| 101 : 286 One who obtains the Sublime Essence of the Lord is satisfied and fulfilled. 101 : 287 One who obtains this Flavor of the Lord does not waver. 101 : 288 One who has this destiny written on his forehead obtains the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. ||3|| 101 : 289 The Lord has come into the hands of the One, the Guru, who has blessed so many with good fortune. 101 : 290 Attached to Him, a great many have been liberated. 101 : 291 35

The Gurmukh obtains the Treasure of the Naam; says Nanak, those who see the Lord are very rare. ||4||15||22|| 101 : 292 Maajh, Fifth Mehl: 101 : 293 My Lord, Har, Har, Har, is the nine treasures, the supernatural spiritual powers of the Siddhas, wealth and prosperity. 101 : 294 He is the Deep and Profound Treasure of Life. 101 : 295 Hundreds of thousands, even millions of pleasures and delights are enjoyed by one who falls at the Guru's Feet. ||1|| 101 : 296 Gazing upon the Blessed Vision of His Darshan, all are sanctified, 101 : 297 and all family and friends are saved. 101 : 298 By Guru's Grace, I meditate on the Inaccessible and Unfathomable True Lord. ||2|| 101 : 299 The One, the Guru, who is sought by all−only a few, by great good fortune, receive His Darshan. 101 : 300 Raag Maajh − Part 008 36

His Place is lofty, infinite and unfathomable; the Guru has shown me that palace. ||3|| 101 : 301 Your Ambrosial Name is deep and profound. 101 : 302 That person is liberated, in whose heart You dwell. 101 : 303 The Guru cuts away all his bonds; O Servant Nanak, he is absorbed in the poise of intuitive peace. ||4||16||23|| 101 : 304 Maajh, Fifth Mehl: 101 : 305 By God's Grace, I meditate on the Lord, Har, Har. 101 : 306 By God's Kindness, I sing the songs of joy. 101 : 307 While standing and sitting, while sleeping and while awake, meditate on the Lord, all your life. ||1|| 101 : 308 The Holy Saint has given me the Medicine of the Naam. 101 : 309 My sins have been cut out, and I have become pure. Raag Maajh − Part 008 37

101 : 310 I am filled with bliss, and all my pains have been taken away. All my suffering has been dispelled. ||2|| 101 : 311 One who has my Beloved on his side, is liberated from the world−ocean. 101 : 312 One who recognizes the Guru practices Truth; why should he be afraid? ||3|| 101 : 313 Since I found the Company of the Holy and met the Guru, the demon of pride has departed. 101 : 314 With each and every breath, Nanak sings the Lord's Praises. The True Guru has covered my sins. ||4||17||24|| 101 : 315 Maajh, Fifth Mehl: 101 : 316 Through and through, the Lord is intermingled with His servant. 101 : 317 God, the Giver of Peace, cherishes His servant. 101 : 318 I carry the water, wave the fan, and grind the grain for the servant of my Lord and Master. ||1|| 101 : 319 Raag Maajh − Part 008 38

God has cut the noose from around my neck; He has placed me in His Service. 101 : 320 The Lord and Master's Command is pleasing to the mind of His servant. 101 : 321 He does that which pleases his Lord and Master. Inwardly and outwardly, the servant knows his Lord. ||2|| 101 : 322 You are the All−knowing Lord and Master; You know all ways and means. −− Raag Maajh − Part 008 −− Raag Maajh − Part 008 39

Raag Maajh − Part 009 102 : 323 The servant of the Lord and Master enjoys the Love and Affection of the Lord. 102 : 324 That which belongs to the Lord and Master, belongs to His servant.
